item.title: Madrid - Real-time Traffic
item.description: 1 Load Data 2 Data Cleaning 2.1 Georreferencing 2.2 Data Cleaning 2.3 Merging 3 Exploratory Data Analysis 3.1 Missing Data 3.2 Distributions 3.3 Correlations 4 Maps 4.1 Speed 4.2 Congestion 5 Extension 5.1 Load the data 5.2 Quick Visual Analysis 5.3 Plotting Average Speed over Time 5.4 Road use over time 5.5 Cars per Hour 1 Load Data Let’s start with some open, real-time, Madrid traffic data!

item.title: Pets in Madrid
item.description: 1 Intro 2 Loading and Cleaning 3 Cats vs Dogs 4 Demographic Data 1 Intro Let’s try and get some information on pets in Madrid! Fortunately, they have information freely available on datos.madrid.es. This will only be a short analysis and we will try to see if we can find some basic patterns in the data. Let’s start by loading our libraries. 2 Loading and Cleaning First we load this data:

item.title: Shiny Stock App
item.description: Now, a friend of mine had been looking around for an extension to let him download historic stock data. Now, these extensions in Excel tend to use macros and break often, so I figured this would be a nice opportunity to learn all about Shiny in R and make him an application. The link to the final application can be found here. The actual R code it uses is quite simplistic.
